name: Expert
description: A bard plays a musical instrument. This card implies expertise, rightly or wrongly applied.

person.upright: A person (perhaps a bard, a rogue, a ranger, or an artificer) with exactly the right skills for the task at hand.
person.reverse: A person who believes themself an expert but isn't actually helpful.

creatureTrap.upright: A creature with abilities similar to those of a bard, ranger, or rogue, such as expertise in one or more skills.
creatureTrap.reverse: A creature that relies on brute strength instead of skill or stealth.

place.upright: A place (such as a guild hall) where skilled folk gather to share their expertise.
place.reverse: A place where children learn the basics of useful skills.

treasure.upright: A treasure with practical use, such as a musical instrument or a tool.
treasure.reverse: A wildly impractical treasure with no actual use, unwieldy to wear or display.

situation.upright: A situation that requires and rewards the expert application of practical skills.
situation.reverse: A situation stemming from someone's expertise being overlooked or ignored.
